name: Struffoli
author: Jess
summary: Struffoli are little balls of dough in a honey/sugar glaze, with nonpareil sprinkles. My grandma always made them for Christmas, but since she can't do it anymore, I came up with my own variation that she loves because mine are a little bit sweeter than the traditional bread-like ones. Also, they have to be formed into a tower...it's tradition.
ingredients: ¼ cup all-purpose flour, or as needed
2 cups vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
½ cup honey, or more to taste
½ cup white sugar, or more to taste
1 tablespoon rainbow nonpareil sprinkles, or to taste
directions: Beat eggs, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, and vanilla extract together in a bowl; stir in baking powder
Slowly stir flour, about 1 tablespoon at a time, into egg mixture until a soft dough forms
Heat 2 cups vegetable oil in a large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) or until you see little waves on the bottom of the saucepan
Working in small batches, fry dough balls in the hot oil until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes per batch
Transfer struffoli to a paper towel-lined plate using a slotted spoon
Heat honey in a saucepan over medium-low heat
Slowly mix 1/2 cup sugar, a few tablespoons at a time, into honey until sugar is melted and glaze is smooth, about 5 minutes
Transfer struffoli to a large bowl and pour glaze over the top; toss quickly to evenly coat before glaze hardens
Form struffoli into a tower-shape or Christmas tree-shape on a serving plate
Sprinkle nonpareils sprinkles over the struffoli
